title: Is Geert Wilders popular among younger people in the Netherlands? - Quora

response.answer_text: As far as i can tell from the people around me, not one voted for Geert Wilders during the last elections. We were terrified that the same scenario could happen in the USA with Mr Trump being elected. Luckily this didn't happen and the largest party in the Netherlands remains the VVD. The PVV did end up second, which is still a bit scary. From what I think, the majority of voters voting for the PVV, the party of Geert Wilders, is low educated (of course not all), has a low income and who are living in the non-urban areas across the country. Usually these people are in the age group of 40–80 who believe the world is changing in a bad way, who were raised with the beliefs of Protestantism, Catholicism or no religion at all and believe that the Islam is not bringing the world any good and that Muslims are the source of evil. Well that's pretty sad if you ask me.

Geert Wilders supporters are mostly RuralOlder, born pre 1950Lower educatedLower income.Although he does have support outside the list above, he is not terribly popular among the youth, many think he looks and talks weird. I actually only know two people born post 1970 who support him, and they both have a mental disability, and live and work in a protected environment.
